interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: LEGO Ninjago Masters of Spinjitzu (DVD)
Review Date: 2014/09/17
Store: Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'LEGO Ninjago Masters of Spinjitzu', 'Masters of Spinjitzu: a new force to save the world! The world of Ninjago is in terrible danger. An army of skeletons has invaded from the underworld, under the command of the evil Lord Garmadon. Their goal: capture the Four Weapons of Spinjitzu, artifacts so powerful it is said no one being can wield them all at once. Now Garmadon’s brother, the heroic Sensei Wu, must gather four young men and train them in the ways of the ancient art of Spinjitzu. These four – Kai, Jay, Zane and Cole – must become ninja and stand against the dark power of Garmadon and his evil skeleton army. If they fail, the four weapons will be lost and Ninjago doomed forever.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'The two-part adventure', 'Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu', "is based on a line of toys Lego introduced in 2011. Kai, a young blacksmith, is eager--too eager--to forge a great sword. He initially snubs the unassuming Sensei Wu, the master of Spinjitzu martial arts. When Kai's sister Nya is kidnapped by Samukai and his skeleton army from the Underworld, Wu realizes the evil Garmadon is using Samukai to find four legendary weapons that will give him enormous power. Wu trains Kai to join his student-warriors, Jay, Zane, and Cole, and keep Garmadon from seizing power.", 'Masters of Spinjitzu', "is a lightweight, product-based adventure, but it's not a terribly original one. The training sequence, which pits Kai against a series of armed mechanical devices, borrows heavily from", 'Kung Fu Panda', '. Other elements recall', 'Naruto', 'and', 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles', ', and the filmmakers blithely mix Chinese, Japanese, and Western elements. But little kids who love their Lego toys will probably overlook these shortcoming and enjoy the adventure, which is obviously designed to kick off a series. Parents should be prepared to field requests for the many toys that appear in', 'Masters of Spinjitzu', '. (Unrated; suitable for ages 5 and older: cartoon violence)', '--Charles Solomon']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25195594', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Animated', 'Run time': '44 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 27, 2012', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Our 5 year old grandson can't get enough of the Ninjago series.  I wish all of season 3 would be available in the USA, but apparently it's not.  (Why can other countries get it and we can't? Bummer!)  One thing I, as a septuagenarian adult, like very much is that the characters have a moral compass, even though there is the usual cartoon mayhem.  Also, the oriental aesthetic is a refreshing change from the ordinary cartoon graphics.  Well done.
Review Title: From the grandparents of a 5 year old boy
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

['Product Description', 'LEGO Ninjago Masters of Spinjitzu', 'Masters of Spinjitzu: a new force to save the world! The world of Ninjago is in terrible danger. An army of skeletons has invaded from the underworld, under the command of the evil Lord Garmadon. Their goal: capture the Four Weapons of Spinjitzu, artifacts so powerful it is said no one being can wield them all at once. Now Garmadon’s brother, the heroic Sensei Wu, must gather four young men and train them in the ways of the ancient art of Spinjitzu. These four – Kai, Jay, Zane and Cole – must become ninja and stand against the dark power of Garmadon and his evil skeleton army. If they fail, the four weapons will be lost and Ninjago doomed forever.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'The two-part adventure', 'Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu', "is based on a line of toys Lego introduced in 2011. Kai, a young blacksmith, is eager--too eager--to forge a great sword. He initially snubs the unassuming Sensei Wu, the master of Spinjitzu martial arts. When Kai's sister Nya is kidnapped by Samukai and his skeleton army from the Underworld, Wu realizes the evil Garmadon is using Samukai to find four legendary weapons that will give him enormous power. Wu trains Kai to join his student-warriors, Jay, Zane, and Cole, and keep Garmadon from seizing power.", 'Masters of Spinjitzu', "is a lightweight, product-based adventure, but it's not a terribly original one. The training sequence, which pits Kai against a series of armed mechanical devices, borrows heavily from", 'Kung Fu Panda', '. Other elements recall', 'Naruto', 'and', 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles', ', and the filmmakers blithely mix Chinese, Japanese, and Western elements. But little kids who love their Lego toys will probably overlook these shortcoming and enjoy the adventure, which is obviously designed to kick off a series. Parents should be prepared to field requests for the many toys that appear in', 'Masters of Spinjitzu', '. (Unrated; suitable for ages 5 and older: cartoon violence)', '--Charles Solomon']

Our 5 year old grandson can't get enough of the Ninjago series.  I wish all of season 3 would be available in the USA, but apparently it's not.  (Why can other countries get it and we can't? Bummer!)  One thing I, as a septuagenarian adult, like very much is that the characters have a moral compass, even though there is the usual cartoon mayhem.  Also, the oriental aesthetic is a refreshing change from the ordinary cartoon graphics.  Well done.
From the grandparents of a 5 year old boy
profile:
The user demonstrates a strong interest in family-friendly entertainment, particularly animated series that appeal to younger audiences. They exhibit a preference for action-packed narratives featuring strong moral themes, evident from their positive remarks about character integrity in the Ninjago series. The user values content that balances fun with ethical lessons, suggesting a thoughtful approach to media consumption, especially in relation to children's programming.

Additionally, the user appreciates diverse cultural elements in animation, noting the refreshing oriental aesthetic as a highlight of the series. This indicates an inclination towards media that offers rich visual and thematic diversity. Their feedback also reveals a possible interest in nostalgia, given that they are a septuagenarian reflecting on their grandchild’s experiences with modern shows.

The user's engagement shows a desire for accessibility of content, expressing disappointment over regional limitations affecting series availability. Overall, the user prioritizes high-quality, morally engaging entertainment for children, with an appreciation for artistic diversity and a nostalgic connection to media that resonates across generations.
